class_notes: This course analyzes current theoretical approaches to development and evaluates real-world policies that aim to address low state capacity, policing, election quality, and migration and displacement, to improve human welfare in lower- and middle-income countries around the world.
course_description: Influence of political institutions (e.g. democracy), domestic interests, external constraints (e.g. global value chains), and structural factors (e.g. natural resources) on various types of development (e.g. GDP growth, economic upgrading, poverty alleviation, green growth, human development).
sections: Class Nbr: 2000, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: N. Ichino, Status: Open
